result.execSummary:
The defendant Allyson A Wachowiak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Absolute sobriety.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending review.

09-18-2015/Jeffery Kremers
Defendant is non-compliant with probation conditions.
The court ordered that a commitment be issued forthwith directing the Sheriff of Milwaukee County to take the said Defendant into custody to spend 110 days straight time, with no good time credit, as condition time in the House of Correction.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allyson A Wachowiak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 09-18-2015 Court order imposing 110 days condition time.

Defendant Allyson A Wachowiak not in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant has never reported for probation.
  Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed  110 days straight time.

Defendant Allyson A Wachowiak in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties, defendant, Jose L., and Amy W.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 35 DAYS time served, with Huber privileges.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 50 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim, Jose L., unless approved by court or agent. Court allowed third party contact for purpose of time with the children as approved by the agent, the Injunction, and Family Court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

*Court ordered defendant to report to sign up for Probation and Parole by 3:00pm on Tuesday, May 26th, 2015. 

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation


Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Review hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Court set a $1,000.00 Signature Bond with turnover to Justice Point, with all previously ordered conditions remaining in effect.

Defendant Allyson A Wachowiak in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Allyson A Wachowiak in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
JUDGE KONKOL FOR JUDGE GRADY IN BRANCH 23
Case set for Pretrial Conference. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state, the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gabriela A. Leija in court, defendant Allyson A Wachowiak not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Case heard off the record. Defendant NOT produced.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Defense received discovery and an offer and requests an adjourned Pretrial Conference to allow time to discuss with the defendant. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jose S. L-D.

Defendant Allyson A Wachowiak in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Allyson A Wachowiak in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23 due to scheduled Intake week.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
